posts.name: Emir Gümüş
posts.cooked: Hi -I apologize for my not proper english- our team is veteran and have lots of radios with that our new internet connection is far so it is slow. We finally have an idea of turning our one radio to a access point/router/range extender. We search a little if a team did it but couldn’t find so it will be hard. I’ll continue researching, please if any of you have info or document (link) for it make a comment. Thank you for at least reading…

posts.name: Mr. Siefen | 453
posts.cooked: With this if you are trying to use it like a home wifi router id skip the final steps of changing the IP address to match your team numbers, that part will mess up your connection at home if the IP isn’t the same range (it’s probably not in the right range). Everything else however looks correct.
Yep, it is also written in the document that you should skip those steps.

posts.name: Corey Applegate
posts.cooked:
I have in the past been able to struggle through this process but am having no luck at this time.

I seem to be stuck at Listening on interface

I have tried two PC, Both network ports, as well as used the Radio config utility to test if the radio is functional

As we enter into the next era of FRC radio there is going to be a flood of these sitting around the shop. I have used these at work when connecting to automation equipment temporarily during commissioning. It is supper handy to plug into our 24vdc power supply and gain wireless access.

posts.name: Thad House
posts.cooked:
AP51-flash is VERY particular about having the minimal number of NICs enabled. Of which windows is adding a lot more virtual NICs and making this harder.

I’d almost recommend seeing if you can get AP51-flash working on something like a Raspberry Pi, and seeing if that works.

In fact, I actually had a demo one year where I compile AP51-flash for a roboRIO, and used that to flash the firmware on the radio. It was WAY more reliable than the Windows version. However, since we got the new radios, the point of that became moot.

posts.name: Corey Applegate
posts.cooked:
I loaded up a PC with Linux and now have a new issue. First not sure what version of ap51-flash I should use. image 368×766 32.6 KB I randomly tried the -x86_64 From the command line I needed to do the following

image 368×766 32.6 KB

image 368×766 32.6 KB

go to directory

sudo chmod +x ap51-flash-2022.1-x86_64

./ap51-flash-2022.1-x86_64

got the interface (Not sure I needed it because later I forgot to add it to the command and still seem to get the same error)

sudo ./ap51-flash-2022.1-x86_64 [interface] openwrt[version].bin

after a bit I get [my mac address] : is of type ‘redboot’ that we have no image for

So using none windows does seem to get me a bit closer

posts.name: Corey Applegate
posts.cooked:
@Thad_House I have not given up yet. I have tried to use the ap51-flash on other OS’s and laptops with no success. Today I thought about simply trying the FRC Radio Configuration Utility and that has prompted me that the Firmware Flash was successful. Looking into the installed directory I seen there is a AP51-flash.exe and two different Firmware.bin files. So I though I would test running these in the command window. I found this error to pop up each time:

image 833×87 3.73 KB

image 833×87 3.73 KB

image 833×87 3.73 KB

Maybe its a false successful in the Utility or ap51-flash runs differently when executed in the utility vs cmd window with different flags.

I even tried to inject the  openwrt-15.05-ar71xx-generic-om5p-squashfs-factory.bin file by renaming it and replacing the installed version. The utility start to flash but ends up timing out.

Now with closer inspection, the document originally from AndyMark is for the older OM5P-AN and I’m attempting to use a newer model OM5P-AC

posts.name: Ada T
posts.cooked: I have had good experiences using ap51 flash on Linux with the signed images from cloudtrax’s website but I don’t think those are on the internet anymore, also they don’t expose the openwrt config pages so you have to use cloudtrax. Lmk if you need the images and I can send them to you
